title: The Hundred: Chris Woakes wants to play with David Warner and Andre Russell
text:
Chris Woakes is keen to play alongside David Warner and Andre Russell (Picture: Getty)

England all-rounder Chris Woakes has expressed his desire to play alongside Australia star David Warner and West Indies hero Andre Russell in the Hundred.

Woakes will represent Birmingham Phoenix in next summer’s tournament after being selected as the England Test player for the Edgbaston-based franchise.

The 30-year-old will be joined by ‘Local Icons’ Moeen Ali and Pat Brown, while the rest of the 15-man squads will be finalised on Sunday at the official draft.

Asked which players he hopes Phoenix pick up at the draft, England World Cup star Woakes said: ‘That’s a tricky one.

‘There are so many good players out there, not only in this country but overseas as well. But, being a bowler, I’m going to think selfishly here and go for who I don’t want to bowl at…

‘One of the really big, destructive hitters, Andre Russell, springs to mind. David Warner at the top of the order, too – those are the kind of guys who can really hurt bowlers in this format.’

The new 100-balls-a-side competition will run from July 17 to August 16 next summer, and be contested between eight city-based franchise teams.

Woakes added to Sky Sports: ‘I’m really excited to be part of the competition, and feeling really fortunate to be part of it, too.

‘I’m particularly looking forward to the draft. I’ve seen bits of the NFL Draft before, so I’m intrigued to see how this one pans out and how teams go about their business.

Warner enjoyed a superb World Cup last summer (Picture: Getty)

‘Who gets picked up? Maybe a couple of big names will miss out, so I’m sure there will be a few nervous players come the day itself.

‘In my opinion, there is no better place to play cricket than Edgbaston when it is full and bouncing, the Hollies Stand in full voice.

‘I’m really fortunate to have played a lot of cricket there. I’m sure we will get good crowds in there again, they’ll get behind the team and it will be a great place to play.’

West Indies hero Russell is one of the biggest stars in the sport (Picture: Getty)

Asked whether the Hundred can be a global success in years to come, Woakes responded: ‘Of course, there will always be the odd sceptic, which I suppose is understandable.

‘At the same time, I’ve got no doubt that this tournament will thrive. Give it a chance.

‘When you have the world’s best playing each other, in any format, it’s going to make for some amazing cricket. I just can’t wait for it to get started.’
